cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 105 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift west-northwest overnight, then turn northwest Tuesday and accelerate northeast Wednesday-Friday while paralleling the Southeast U.S. coast, then moving out over the western Atlantic south of New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No U.S. landfall currently forecast; closest coastal encounter expected near the Outer Banks of North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge watches confined to Florida-Georgia-South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings confined to portions of the north-western Bahamas and Florida east coast (Jupiter Inlet to Ponte Vedra Beach)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast northward to the Carolinas, then offshore toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England waters
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds late Friday into Saturday; occasional gusty easterlies possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation and strong rip currents possible along the New Jersey shore as the hurricane passes well offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Friday night-Saturday as outer rain-bands brush the area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and rough seas in the New York Bight; potential scheduling impacts to inbound/outbound trans-Atlantic traffic
